task.title: Clock on an Operation in the Search Window

taskbody.context: You can clock on an operation by using the Status option in the search window. You can also clock on an operation in the Ready status in the Open page. For more information, refer to the topic.

step.cmd: In the Machines drop-down list box, select a machine.
In the main navigation bar, select .
step.stepresult: A window containing a list of search options appears.

step.cmd: Select Ready in the STATUS drop-down list box, and then select Search.
step.stepresult: The operations in the Ready status appear.

step.cmd: Select an operation from the search results, and then select ON to enable the clock-on process on an operation.
step.stepresult: The Select a Machine to Continue window appears.

step.cmd: In the Choose One drop-down list box, select a machine, and then select Apply.

info.note: You can use the USER(S) column in the respective application page to access the IDs of the users who have clocked on the operation.

taskbody.result: The selected operation is clocked on and the status of the operation is modified to In Progress. A timer appears in the operation details section to track the time taken to complete an operation.
